sentences.chinese: 先王惡其亂，故制雅頌之聲以道之，使其聲足以樂而不流，使其文足以綸而不息，使其曲直繁省廉肉節奏，足以感動人之善心而已矣，不使放心邪氣得接焉，是先王立樂之方也。
sentences.literal: Former kings hated its chaos, therefore established ya and song sounds to guide it; made their sound sufficient for joy but not licentious; made their patterns sufficient to bind but not weary; made their curved straight, ornate simple, upright fleshy rhythms sufficient to move people's good hearts only; did not let dissolute heretical qi connect there; this is former kings' establishment of music's method.

sentences.chinese: 是故樂在宗廟之中，君臣上下同聽之，則莫不和敬；
sentences.literal: Therefore music in ancestral temple within, ruler and ministers superiors and inferiors together listen to it, then none not harmonious and respectful;

sentences.chinese: 在族長鄉里之中，長幼同聽之，則莫不和順；
sentences.literal: In clan leaders neighborhood within, elders and young together listen to it, then none not harmonious and obedient;

sentences.chinese: 在閨門之內，父子兄弟同聽之，則莫不和親。
sentences.literal: In inner chambers within, father son brothers together listen to it, then none not harmonious and intimate.

sentences.chinese: 故樂者，審一以定和，比物以飾節，節奏合以成文，所以合和父子君臣，附親萬民也，是先王立樂之方也。
sentences.literal: Therefore music: examines unity to establish harmony, compares things to adorn measure, rhythms combine to form patterns; thus unites and harmonizes father-son ruler-minister, attaches and intimates myriad people; this is former kings' establishment of music's method.

sentences.chinese: 故聽其雅頌之聲，志意得廣焉；
sentences.literal: Therefore listening to ya and song sounds, will and intention become broad;

sentences.chinese: 執其干戚，習其俯仰詘信，容貌得莊焉；
sentences.literal: Grasping their shield-axes, practicing their bowing raising bending extending, appearance becomes solemn;

sentences.chinese: 行其綴兆，要其節奏，行列得正焉，進退得齊焉。
sentences.literal: Follow their connected signs, grasp their rhythms, ranks and files become correct, advance retreat become orderly.

sentences.chinese: 故樂者天地之齊，中和之紀，人情之所不能免也。
sentences.literal: Therefore music is heaven and earth's equal, central harmony's record, human emotion's that which cannot be avoided.

sentences.chinese: 夫樂者，先王之所以飾喜也；
sentences.literal: Indeed music is former kings' means to adorn joy;

sentences.chinese: 軍旅鈇鉞者，先王之所以飾怒也。
sentences.literal: Military campaigns axes are former kings' means to adorn anger.

sentences.chinese: 故先王之喜怒皆得其齊矣。
sentences.literal: Therefore former kings' joy and anger all obtained their equal.

sentences.chinese: 喜則天下和之，怒則暴亂者畏之。
sentences.literal: Joy then all under heaven harmonize with it, anger then violent disorderly fear it.

sentences.chinese: 先王之道禮樂可謂盛矣。
sentences.literal: Former kings' way of ritual and music can be called flourishing.

sentences.chinese: 魏文侯問於子夏曰：「吾端冕而聽古樂則唯恐臥，聽鄭衛之音則不知倦。
sentences.literal: Duke Wen of Wei asked Zi Xia saying: 'I sit properly capped and listen to ancient music then only fear sleeping, listen to Zheng and Wei sounds then do not know weariness.
